com.googlecode.biscotti.collect

Class LinkedBoundedQueue<E>

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.google.common.collect.ForwardingObject
      • com.google.common.collect.ForwardingCollection<E>
        • com.google.common.collect.ForwardingQueue<E>
          • com.googlecode.biscotti.collect.LinkedBoundedQueue<E>
  • Type Parameters:
    E - the type of elements held in this queue
    All Implemented Interfaces:
    BoundedQueue<E>, Serializable, Cloneable, Iterable<E>, Collection<E>, Queue<E>

    public final class LinkedBoundedQueue<E>
extends ForwardingQueue<E>
implements BoundedQueue<E>, Cloneable, Serializable
    A linked list implementation of BoundedQueue. This queue orders elements in first-in-first-out (FIFO) manner; it considers the eldest element to be the least recently inserted element. To prevent this queue from exceeding its capacity restrictions the eldest element is removed as needed when calling add(E), offer(E), and addAll(Collection) methods. Elements may be null.

    This queue is not thread-safe. If multiple threads modify this queue concurrently it must be synchronized externally.

    Author:
    Zhenya Leonov
    See Also:
    LinkedList, Serialized Form

      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      boolean add(E e)
      Inserts the specified element into this queue, removing the least-recently-inserted element as necessary to prevent the queue from overflowing.
      boolean addAll(Collection<? extends E> c)
      Adds all of the elements in the specified collection to this queue, removing stale elements (according to their insertion order) as necessary to prevent the queue from overflowing.
      LinkedBoundedQueue<E> clone()
      Returns a shallow copy of this LinkedBoundedQueue.
      static <E> LinkedBoundedQueue<E> create(int maxSize)
      Creates a new LinkedBoundedQueue having the specified maximum size.
      static <E> LinkedBoundedQueue<E> create(Iterable<? extends E> elements)
      Creates a new LinkedBoundedQueue with the same elements, iteration order, and having the maximum size equal to the number of elements in the specified iterable.
      int maxSize()
      Returns the maximum size (the bound) of this queue.
      boolean offer(E e)
      Inserts the specified element into this queue, removing the least-recently-inserted element as necessary to prevent the queue from overflowing.
      int remainingCapacity()
      Returns the number of elements which can be added to this queue before it becomes full.
